alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Decatur and northeastern Seminole Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Donalsonville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bainbridge, Donalsonville, West Bainbridge, Iron City, Climax, Brinson, Vada, Hanover, Ausmac, Eldorendo, Decatur Co A/P, Steinham Store, Cyrene and Sharphagen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
